movesets.name: Choice Band

items.name: Choice Band
items.description: Raises Attack by 50%, but locks the user into one move.

movesets.description:
Moves

Choice Band STAB Brave Bird hits very hard, making it the preferred move to use. U-turn is to gain momentum and do some decent damage. Cross Poison is the secondary STAB move that Crobat can use, doing a lot of damage with Choice Band. Defog is a viable option as Crobat is rather limited with its options, and it can provide the utility of getting rid of entry hazards. Sleep Talk lets Crobat work as a sleep absorber, and Super Fang is a viable option for the last slot to take half of the opponents health away. Lastly, Quick Attack is a form of priority, but it isn't very good to be locked into.

Set Details

Max Attack investment with a neutral nature in combination with the Choice Band lets Crobat hit very hard with Brave Bird. 252 Speed EVs with a Jolly nature max out Crobat's Speed, but Adamant is an option if you don't mind being outsped by positively natured base 115s. Lastly, Infiltrator is great on a Choice Band user to get rid of Substitute users.

Usage Tips

Brave Bird usually will dent most things by a lot if they don't resist it, making it the ideal move to be locked into. U-turn creates offensive momentum and is best used on the switch against an Electric-, Steel-, or Rock-types. Defog is best used early game as this Crobat variant will be seen switching in and out a lot. Cross Poison also can hit Electric-types hard on the switch. This set is best used against offensive teams with many Fighting-types as Crobat can make big dents in them.

Team Options

Dugtrio can take on STAB Rock-, Electric-, and Steel-types well as it traps the users and obliterates them with STAB Earthquake. Machamp is also a good partner as it can use Earthquake on Electric-types and can use DynamicPunch to hurt Rock- and Steel-types. Swampert and Cloyster appreciate Crobat taking Grass-type moves for them, and Pokemon such as Double Dance Porygon-Z and Curselax enjoy the removal of Fighting-types as well. Lastly, Crobat also works well with Rotom-H as it loves entry hazards being removed and it can take Electric- and Ice-type moves for Crobat.

movesets.name: Support

items.name: Black Sludge
items.description: Recovers 1/16 of max HP each turn for Poison-types. Damages all other types by 1/8 of max HP each turn.

movesets.description:
Moves

Brave Bird is Crobat's decently strong STAB attack on this set, allowing it to do some reasonable damage to opposing threats which don't resist it. U-turn is an ideal move for a fast Pokemon like Crobat, allowing it to quickly gain offensive momentum. However, Toxic is also a viable option to trouble walls such as Slowking on the switch. Super Fang is also a good option as it takes away half of an opponent's health. Defog is great to get rid of entry hazards, but Crobat is weak to Stealth Rock, meaning it can't come and go as it pleases. Taunt is also good to shut down walls such as Florges and Blissey. Lastly, Roost is for reliable recovery, but be wary of Earthquake users which may take advantage of Crobat losing its Flying typing for one turn.

Set Details

176 Speed EVs with a Jolly nature allow Crobat to outspeed Alakazam, a relevant threat in UU. 248 HP EVs are to take hits better and allow Crobat to take slightly less damage when switching into Stealth Rock. The Attack EVs are mostly for damage, but they can be moved over into Defense to take hits better. An alternative spread of 248 HP / 52 Atk / 4 SpD / 200 Spe with a Jolly Nature allows Crobat to outspeed Jolly Noivern. Another alternative spread of 120 HP / 248 Atk / 4 SpD / 136 Speed with a Jolly nature can be used for more power. 4 SpD is used to give Porygon-Z the an Attack boost because of Download. Infiltrator is the preferred ability to beat Substitute users, making Crobat a better stallbreaker, rather than using Inner Focus to counter Fake Out Mienshao. Lastly, Black Sludge provides passive recovery and discourages the use of Trick as well.

Usage Tips

This set is mostly an anti-hazard set, which depends on what moves have been chosen. If Defog has been used, it needs to be used to clean out entry hazards and is most appropriately used when the opposing entry hazard setter has fainted. If Taunt is being used, it can stop entry hazard setters from setting up at all. Roost is best used when Earthquake users aren't in play so Crobat can use it freely. Brave Bird is not exactly a spammable move against defensive teams as it does nothing but whittle away Crobat's HP, and it should best be used against offensive ones. Finally, this set checks Fighting-types much better than most Defoggers such as Mega Aerodactyl, but Crobat should still watch out for Stone Edge.

Team Options

Swampert makes for a great partner; it takes on Electric-types for Crobat, and Crobat can get rid of Grass-types for Swampert, forming a good defensive core. Swampert also can get Stealth Rock set up. Hazard-weak Pokemon, such as Victini and Mega Houndoom, also love the Defog support. Crobat works well with Rotom-H as it loves entry hazards being removed as well as its can take Electric- and Ice-type moves for Crobat.

moves.name: Acrobatics
moves.description: Doubles in power if user has no held item.

moves.name: Aerial Ace
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Air Cutter
moves.description: High critical hit rate.

moves.description: High critical hit rate.

moves.name: Astonish
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Bite
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Brave Bird
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil damage.

moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confuse Ray
moves.description: Confuses the target.

moves.name: Cross Poison
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate. 10% chance to poison foe.

moves.name: Curse
moves.description: Does 1/4 of max HP damage per turn at the cost of half the user's max HP if the user is a Ghost. Boosts Attack and Defense and lowers Speed by 1 stage otherwise.

moves.name: Dark Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Defog
moves.description: Lowers target's evasion by 1 stage. Removes various field effects.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Feint Attack
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Gust

moves.name: Haze
moves.description: Eliminates all stat changes.

moves.name: Heat Wave
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.description: Puts the foe to sleep.

moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt.

moves.name: Mean Look
moves.description: The target cannot switch out.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.name: Nasty Plot
moves.description: Boosts Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Ominous Wind
moves.description: 10% chance to boost all stats by 1 stage.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Pluck
moves.description: Uses foe's Berry.

moves.description: 30% chance to inflict bad poison.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Pursuit
moves.description: Doubles in power if the target switches, and hits them before they can escape.

moves.name: Quick Attack
moves.description: The user always attacks first.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Roost
moves.description: Heals 50% HP. Temporarily removes the user's Flying-type.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Screech
moves.description: Lowers foe's Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Shadow Ball
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Sky Attack
moves.description: Hits the turn after being used.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Sludge Bomb
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Snatch
moves.description: If certain moves are used, the user of Snatch uses the moves instead.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Steel Wing
moves.description: 10% chance to raise the user's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Substitute

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Super Fang
moves.description: Does damage equal to half the foe's current HP.

moves.name: Supersonic
moves.description: Confuses the foe.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swift
moves.description: Always hits.

moves.name: Tailwind
moves.description: Doubles Speed for 3 turns.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Thief
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Torment
moves.description: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Twister
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

moves.name: U-turn
moves.description: Attacks, then switches.

moves.name: Uproar
moves.description: Repeats for 2-5 turns. No Pokemon can sleep during these turns.

moves.name: Venom Drench
moves.description: Lowers the Attack, Special Attack, and Speed stats of a poisoned target.

moves.name: Venoshock
moves.description: Hits poisoned targets with double Base Power.

moves.name: Whirlwind
moves.description: Forces the target to switch to a random Pokemon.

moves.name: Wing Attack
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: X-Scissor
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Zen Headbutt
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

abilities.name: Infiltrator
abilities.description: The wielder bypasses the foe's Light Screen, Reflect, Mist, Safeguard, and Substitute.
